nerdpress.name: NERDPress
nerdpress.description: NERDPress is the working title for a very young CMS concieved by myself as an ongoing sideproject.
nerdpress.longDescription:
NERDPress is the working title for a very young CMS concieved by myself as an ongoing sideproject.

NERDPress consists on two projects in one; A JSON API written on top of Express on node as well as a front-end written in React.

Utilizing React's server-side rendering capabilities, the state is computed server-side via Redux and React Router. Once its determined which data needs to be fetched, the data is serilized as raw JSON and embedded in the html during in the initial rendering of the app. When the React app boots up on the client-side, the initial data is used to rehydrate the state into the Redux stores.

zap2it.name: Zap2it
zap2it.description: The new Zap2It TV Listings grid is built on React with a custom flux implementaiton utilizing Backbone.
zap2it.longDescription:
Zap2it is a television listings and entertainment website owned by Tribune Media. They came to Doejo in need of a rebuilt television listing grid. React hot new tech at the time and I wanted to build something to showcase it.

Utilizing Backbone models as the stores, it uses Facebook's Flux architecture for state management. (This was before Redux had hit the scene).

Additionally, I built the backend using Express and Node.js with Redis for caching. Easily one of my favorite projects I've worked on, I learned a ton building it.

chicago-ima.name: Chicago Interactive Marketing Association
chicago-ima.description: Migration from Drupal to WordPress with integrations to Eventbrite, Facebook & Braintree.
chicago-ima.longDescription:
The Chicago Interactive Marketing Association came to Doejo for a new website. They wanted to migrate off their Drupal instance on onto a custom WordPress theme.

I utilized a WordPress framework called Timber, which allows for a more MVC-like development experience and uses the Twig templating language, which allowed for a much cleaner seperation between markup and custom logic

The theme included a number of features including a job board and event management capabilities through integration with the Eventbrite API. It uses Braintree payment processing and the Facebook API for event photo albums
